description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att stärka barns rättigheter genom ett lokalt arbete för barns rätt till trygghet och skydd. Kopplar också till nationella mål. Följande mål har satts upp: Nationella planer, som kopplar till lokala processer, för att skydda barn ska vara antagna och barns rätt till skydd integreras i utbildnings- hälso och försörjningssektorn. Programmet genomförs i norra Afgh o Kabul.

The project aims at strengthening the rights of the child through a local commitment to child protection. There is also a connection to national goals. The following objectives have been set: national child protection plans, connecting to local processes, shall be in place and child protection shall be integrated into education, healt and livelihood. The program is carried out in the north and in Kabul.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Given the difficult context in which the project has managed and the short period (only 2,5 years), it is difficult to measure any outcome or impact of the project. However Save the children has during the period contributed to reactivating 6 District Child Protection Action Networks, DCPANs, and establishing and activating 2 others. Save the Children has also influenced the increase of female members on DCPANs – 10 percent of their members are now women A Child Safeguarding Policy for orphanages, Juvenile Rehabilitation Centres and CPANs has been drafted and has been acknowledged by the Director of DOLSAMD, Department of Labour, Social Affairs, Martyrs and Disabled, pending approval by the Ministry of Justice. Save the Children has also supported the establishment, orientation and capacity building of 120 community based child protection networks (CBCPNs). In total 1,200 members were provided with basic knowledge and skills on child protection issues and response strategies. Regular monitoring and feedback from the CBCPNs, the communities and the children’s groups demonstrates increased awareness of child protection risks and vulnerabilities, including harmful and traditional practices such as early child marriage, resulting in higher enrolment and retention rates in schools especially for girls. Save the Children continues to work with training of street children. 173 children living and working in the street (or at risk thereof) out of 201 enrolled children (116 girls) completed 5-6 months of vocational/apprentice training and are currently employed. All participants have received start-up tool kits. Monitoring reports indicate increased incomes for many of the participants; girls who embarked on embroidery enterprises (in four target areas) have had their income increased by 40 percent whereas 28 percent of girls in Kabul reported an increase of their household income. Regular household visits were made to 2,059 parents/caregivers of children working in the streets with a focus on Positive Parenting and risks and vulnerabilities with working in the streets. 362 police officers participated in training programs on child protection with a specific focus on Positive Policing of children living and working in the street. 24 Children’s Centres were established and supported by communities for children living and working in the street and those most at-risk thereof 2,059 children participated in centre activities for life skills, basic literacy and numeracy, recreation and learning. 1,788 girls and boys participated in School Student Council initiatives including training on child rights, peer to peer education (self-protection). 1,606 teachers (866 female) have received training and technical support on Positive Discipline. 92 complaints boxes were set up in the schools to assist children and parents to raise concerns related to learning, teaching and disciplining. And the progress shows that 27 percent of the households in the target areas are utilising Positive Discipline practices with their children.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
